intro: Hieracium monoclades, commonly known as the single-stem hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has a rosette of basal leaves and a single, upright stem that bears the flowering head. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a composite structure, consisting of many small florets.
